Name: Order of Battle: A Supplement for Victory at Sea
Description:
Mongoose Publishing's Victory at Sea WWII naval combat game (Victory at Sea original design by Matthew Sprange) is expanded in this 120+ page supplement. New rules and fleet lists increase historical accuracy and give players new options for historical and "build your own" fleets. Contents include:


    New Rules (shore batteries, night battles, terrain, kamikazes, minefields)
    Motor Torpedo Boats 
    Admirals 
    Advanced Air Operations 
    Scenarios 
    Operational Campaign Rules
    Expanded Fleet Lists 
    The Royal Navy 
    The Kriegsmarine 
    The United States Navy 
    The Imperial Japanese Navy 
    The Italian Navy 
    The French Navy 
    The Soviet Navy 
    Civilian Shipping


Expands:

    Victory at Sea: World War II Naval Combat Game
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Sin Verguenza
Description:
This is a A Question of Scruples based game but comes with 288 new moral dilemmas.
Players will have to make each other questions. For each question you will have to choose the person you think will give the answer (yes/no) you have in your hand. If the answer is a match, he can discard that card, but if not he will have to draw another question card.
Of course, all players get to vote if the answer is true or false.
The first player to get rid of all cards winds the game.

Name: Descarado
Description:
The particularity about this A Question of Scruples based game is that the questions are based on moral dilemmas involving the characters of the T.V. show Descarado

Content:


     300 questions
     12 Yes/No cards
     Rules

Name: Travel Tribond Kids
Description:
Be the first to reach 15 points.  Earn points by solving a clue set of three items with a common "bond."

Travel edition includes 250 clue sets on 50 cards, one card sleeve, score board and scoring pegs.
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Playball Card Game
Description:
From the box: "This fast moving card game has all the action of a real baseball game.  Players take turns at bat and in the field.  You can strike out, foul out, tag a runner at first, hit a home run, field a foul ball and more."

The game box also functions as a score keeping device by marking the score with the provided paperboard bats into slots at the proper numbers. The game is mostly dictated by the spinner and the cards are primarily the game board and status markers for the spinner results. The one exception is the fielding cards which will give variable results for base running after hits are spun. There is little to no decision making in the game as it is totally run by the spinner and fielding cards.

The instructions are in English and French.

Name: Salad Bowl
Description:
"The entertaining game that is energizing and challenging, yet easy for everyone to play.  Professional acting ability is not required, though quick wit and good memory are essential to success.  Come find out if you've got the right ingredients to win!"

Names of famous people are secretly written on pieces of party at the beginning of the game.  There are three phases: Say Anything, Triple Threat and Charades.  A representative from the playing team gives clues to get their team mates to guess the name.  In Say Anything, players can give any clues but the name on the paper or initials.  In Triple Threat, only three word clues can be given.  Charades require only acting, no words.  Each round, correctly guessed names are placed in the next round's bowl.  Players who have been playing close attention the previous round are at an advantage.

Equipment includes three bowls, marked for each round.  Perforated tablets for writing names.  Pencils.  Timer.  Dice.  Gameboard (place holder for bowls).

Essentially the same game as Celebrities or Time's Up!

Name: Don't Step on the Croc, Doc
Description: This is an action children's game where each player has the role of an adventurer trying to cross a rope bridge to retrieve bars of gold.  To retrieve the gold from the middle of setup, a player will have to move his piece across the heads of sleeping crocodiles, any of which could wake up if the player's not careful.

Name: Destination Wild West
Description:
The year is 1865. In the U.S., the taming of the West is at its peak. Railway lines are busy building a transcontinental railroad linking the East and West. Competition between the biggest companies is fierce: each is trying to lay down the longest track. 
 
During this period, pioneers from very different backgrounds were brought together. Their interactions created a new and mythical society in a land of natural beauty. Many of these settlers carved out a place in history.  
  
It is in this legendary world that you must build your own railroad and board as many passengers as possible. However, be aware of the dangers: tribes trying to protect their land, a harsh environment full of surprises, and outlaws prowling the desert in search of riches. Keep an eye on your opponents, and a closer one on your friends, for each person is trying to beat you to the ultimate destination: the Wild West!

Name: Comet: Crete 1941
Description: This is a game for two players (representing German and Allied forces) and is played out on the island of Crete, in the Eastern Mediterranean, in May 1941.  German parachute and glider troops began an assault to seize control of three airfields along the North coast at 0600 on 20 May 1941; they were to be followed by airborne and seaborne reinforcements.  COMET - Crete 1941 focuses on the action around two of the German objectives – Maleme airfield and Souda (COMET was the German codeword for the western assault).  The German player’s aim is to obtain a foothold so that follow-on forces can land and take permanent control of the objectives.  The aim of the Allied player is to prevent the German reinforcements from landing and subsequently to defeat the assault forces.  The game is played in alternate turns each player being able to move playing pieces and make attacks against their opponent in succession.

Name: Singapore 1941: Fall of the Fortress
Description:
This is a two-player game that simulates the Far East Campaign between the invading force, the Japanese, and the defenders, the Commonwealth forces led by the British, from the period starting 8th December 1941 to the 15th February 1942. The game allows two players to command either the Japanese or Commonwealth forces over ten weekly turns with the outcome determined by victory conditions based on various elements such as the captured of key installations, territory captured and force depletion.

Map scale: 1 hex = 17 km
Unit scale: regiment/brigade
Time scale: 1 turn = approx. 1 week

Name: The Battle of Midway: Four Fatal Hours
Description:
This is a solitaire simulation of the four fatal hours of June 4th 1942 that would decide the outcome of the Battle of Midway. It is set over 8 half hour turns between 07:00 which was the approximate time of the first American attack, and 11:00 which was the approximate time of the first Japanese counter strike at the American carriers. You represent Admiral Nagumo in command of Carrier Divisions one and two. The orders you were given before setting sail were two-fold, firstly strike the Midway Atoll so as to allow for a follow-up invasion, and secondly, strike any American carriers which sail out to challenge you.

Your goal throughout this game is to carry out these orders and to keep your carriers afloat. Victory points will be awarded according to the level of success you achieve in meeting these goals.

Name: The Citadel of Prokhorovka (Kursk 1943)
Description:
The Citadel of Prokhorovka is a board game simulating the conflict around the small Russian town of
Prokhorovka, which was fought on Monday 12 July 1943 between German and Soviet forces. The battle
plan was part of Operation Citadel, Hitler’s attempt to eliminate the large Kursk bulge at the Eastern Front,
consolidate his defence line by about 80 miles and deprive the Soviets of any serious capacity to attack for
the rest of 1943. The fighting mainly took place among the armoured formations of the two sides, but the
participation of infantry, artillery and air force was also important and is reflected in the game.

Name: Anzio: Drive to Rome (1944)
Description:
Anzio – Drive to Rome is a two player, World War Two regimental level simulation covering the first month of fighting in the Anzio bridgehead in Italy during January and February 1944. Under the auspices of Operation Shingle, Allied units from both the United States of America and Great Britain conducted a beach landing in the area surrounding Anzio in an attempt to seize the strategic Alban Hills and cut the supply to German troops fighting further south near Monte Cassino. Ultimately, the invading forces had the potential of capturing Rome, described by Churchill as “the keys to Europe”. Planning for the invasion of Normandy, Operation Overlord, was well advanced and any success or failure at Anzio would surely lead to ramifications for the larger invasion planned for France.

In Anzio – Drive to Rome, each player takes command of either the Allied of Axis forces, and each player moves his supplied pieces in an attempt to fulfill the victory conditions as set out further below. The game commences on 22nd January 1944 following the Allied invasion and finishes on 1st March 1944 unless the automatic victory conditions are fulfilled by either player.

Name: Subbuteo Urban Arena
Description:
From the publishers website:

Subbuteo Urban Arena is fast paced, 5-a-side football at its best. Customise your arena and show off with outrageous tricks using players from Europe's finest clubs.

Name: Rei dos Piratas
Description:
From the box: Command your ship crossing the seas in search of incredible treasures. Play with Pirates, the Navy or the Phantom! Amazing emotions await you in this amused marine adventure
Da Caixa "Comande se navio cruzando os mares em busca de incríveis tesouros. Jogue com Piratas, a Marinha ou Navio Pirata! Incríveis emoções o aguardam nessa divertida aventura marítima". Veja no site:
http://www.paisefilhos.ind.br/

Name: Hackers
Description:
From the Box
An exciting adventure in the virtual world, where you are a hacker with the mission of infecting an Evil Server to save the world!

Source: http://www.paisefilhos.ind.br/

Da Caixa:
Uma aventura eletrizante no mundo virtual, onde voce é um hacker com a missão de infectar um Servidor do mal para salvar o mundo!

Fonte: http://www.paisefilhos.ind.br/

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures Handbook
Description:
Create fantasy armies with counters or miniatures and fight battles. Designed for use with Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures and/or Third Edition AD&D RPG game.

Expands

    Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Fantastic Locations: Fields of Ruin
Description:
D&D Miniatures Fantastic Locations Map Pack: Includes Scenario and 4 printed maps.

Map Locations:
Keep of the Fallen Kings 1 and 2
Dungeon of Blood
The Kings Road

Name: Monopoly: Twin Cities
Description: This is a 1997 variant of Monopoly issued by USAopoly based on the Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul, and their surrounding suburbs.  Local Twin Cities landmarks, businesses, and organizations take the place of the familiar Atlantic City streets, and are grouped according to similar types.  For example, the orange group, St. James Place, Tennessee Avenue, and New York Avenue, in this edition are replaced by the sports teams the University of Minnesota Golden Gophers, the Minnesota Vikings, and the Minnesota Twins, respectively.  Another example of this is the yellow group, traditionally Atlantic Avenue, Ventnor Avenue, and Marvin Gardens being replaced by the hotels Radisson Saint Paul, Minneapolis Hilton and Towers, and The Marquette Minneapolis Hotel.  The bank notes are also branded with National City Bank and Twin Cities Edition.

Name: Jurassic Quest
Description:
This is a game from Wild Goose that involves dinosaurs. There can be two to four players. You must avoid hot lava, endless swamps, and a bottomless tar pit. You must also build a T-Rex puzzle and answer questions. The first to reach the top of the volcano is the winner. This is a fun game with a lot of scientific information.

Ages 8 and up

Original Game Contents:

- Gameboard
- Instruction sheet
- 4 dinosaur pieces
- standard six-sided die
- 1 Disaster die (lightning bolt, T-Rex and 4 blank sides)
- 132 Question cards
- 33 Disaster cards
- 4 T-Rex puzzles (six pieces each)
- A pull-together volcano
- Sheet of static-cling lava pieces

'Survival is the name of this dinosaur game'. Wild Goose Co. promises 'Real science, real fun' and offers several high-quality sets to prove it

Name: Monkey Business
Description:
Monkey Business - Cash is Kong!

Setting
What do you do when a pestering primate is wrecking havoc at the junkyard where you work? The obvious, of course: throw money at the problem!

With the Monkey Business expansion, Spank the Monkey enters the glamorous world of champagne-filled hot tubs and gold-plated supermodels. Sure, it's still just a junkyard, but it's a blinged-out junkyard filled with the spoils of the rich and famous. And with the introduction of the green stuff comes a whole range of new, exciting possibilities. Spend to succeed in your actions, and use your wad of cash to buy yourself out of trouble. But, as always, be the first to Spank the Monkey.

How to Play
Each player starts with one coin. During the game players will be able to earn more coins and use their coins in various ways.

There are essentially three ways that you can spend your coins. First of all there are cards that you have to pay for when playing them such as Insurance Policy and Sexy Monkey Outfit. Secondly, there are Junk cards and Reinforcement cards that require you to pay an upkeep each turn if you want to keep them in your tower. Finally, you can buy extra cards in addition to the ones you draw as normal. The first card you buy during a turn costs 1 coin, the second 2 coins, the third 3 coins, etc.

To be able to spend coins, you also have to earn coins. Luckily, some Junk cards such as the Oil Tower and the Bank Note Printing Press give you an income each turn as long as they are in your tower. You can also sell Junk cards from your hand. You may sell one Junk card each turn. A Junk card is worth its Strength in coins.

Monkey Business also introduces a new category of Junk cards called Luxury. In this category you can find precious junk such as Limo, Spa and Inflatable Bouncing Castle.

Expands:

    Spank the Monkey


Home Page: http://www.gigantoskop.se/games/monkeybusiness/

Name: Sho
Description: Sho is an ancient Tibetan Dice game. A game pad is placed within reach of the players, with 64 cowry shells placed in an arc around one side of the pad. Each player takes 9 matching coins. 2 dice are placed in a wooden cup. The object of the game is to move all 9 of your matching coins through the arc of cowry shells, in a clockwise direction from one end to the other. The winner is the first to do so. To play; the dice are rolled around in the cup, then the cup is placed sharply (with a snap of the wrist) upside down on top of the pad. The following player lifts the cup, revealing the dice. On each player’s first roll, 3 coins are placed (make a space) past the number of cowry shells equal to the number showing on the dice.  On following rolls, either 1 coin is entered into the arc or coins  already in the arc are moved the amount of spaces showing on the rolled dice. There are Various rules such as "killing" the opponents coins and "stacking" your own, making them more powerful.

Name: A Lover's Touch
Description:
"A romance game for your body, mind and spirit."

From the back of the box:

"A Lover's Touch offers the opportunity for the two of you to experience a wide variety of both physical and emotional intimacies and have fun too!  The game activities have been specially created to progress from affectionate sharing and touching to bolder and more intimate activities that lovers partake in with each other.  For night after night of love, discovery and romantic adventures the game play integrates the 85 intimate game board activities and 54 passionate scenarios from The Lover's Touch Card Game-TM"

From the rule book:

"Object of the Game
-To share with your lover a variety of sensual, intimate, and affectionate delights.

Purposes of the Game
-To have fun developing a deeper understanding of what you and your lover like and want in your intimate relationship.
-To engage in an extended session of love making that builds on anticipation, creativity, adventure, and a progression of physical intimacy.
-To expand you sensory awareness through activities using sight, hearing, taste, smell, and... touch."

The first player to reach the "Final Play" space on the game board ends the game play.  Both players are most definitely winners!

Game components:

-1 game box
-1 rule book (which contains a list of 16 recommended items for use with the game)
-1 advertisement for "www.theromancesuite.com"
-1 game board containing 1 "Begin Here" square, 85 activity squares including 12 "Pick a card." squares, and 1 "Final Play" square
-56 activity cards
-1 red, six-sided die
-1 yellow pawn
-1 white pawn

Name: How To Host A Romantic Evening: Tropical Paradise
Description:
From the company that brought you the "How To Host A Murder" series comes a series of games that are geared towards 2 players.  There are 3 themes to choose from in the "How To Host A Romantic Evening" series: Tropical Paradise, Roman Holiday, and Parisian Night.

From the back of the box: "In her best-selling book, Light His Fire, author Ellen Kreidman shares the secrets of how to keep romance and excitement alive in a relationship.  Those principles were the inspiration for this unique evening of entertainment for two.  How To Host A Romantic Evening-TM is more than a game --- it is an event in which two people rediscover the excitement and attraction that may be forgotten in day-to-day routines."

From the "Host's Guide": "Object: players move around the board by correctly answering the 'Knowledge' or 'Imagination' questions.  When a player lands on a space and answers a question correctly, they keep the card.  Five cards can be redeemed for a Light His/Her Fire Certificate of the player's choice.  The first player to collect 3 certificates wins."

Of course, in a game like this, both players are ultimately winners!

Game components:
-1 game box
-1 game board containing 2 "Start" spaces, 12 "Imagination" spaces, 12 "Knowledge" spaces, and 4 "If possible, take one card from your partner" spaces
-1 "Host's Guide" containing a note from Ellen Kreidman, an introduction, a list of game contents, guides for planning the evening, setting a romantic mood, and costuming, food, drink and dessert recipes, instructions for playing the game, and 18 tips from Ellen Kreidman "on adding romance to your life every day".
-1 advertisement/mail order product sheet
-1 booklet containing 12 "Light His/Her Fire Certificates" which can be redeemed by the winners at a later date
-1 invitation made up to look like a passport
-1 envelope to go with the passport invitation
-24 "Knowledge" cards
-24 "Imagination" cards
-1 white, six-sided die
-1 purple glass playing stone
-1 yellow glass playing stone

Name: Gemstones
Description:
A strategy game of selective acquisition! The modular gameboard consists of 15 black acrylic hexagon rings, 3" diameter. Each "cave" holds two gems drawn at random from the velvet bag. Your goal is to collect 3 different types of gems on each turn, from three caves adjacent in a straight line. A wild card (clear stone) lets you collect a fourth, or alter the board. Six kinds of gems (102 in all) with varying values and quantities to collect with careful planning. Refill the caves from the bag after each turn and mark the harvested hollows with 3 black stones. At least one of your three caves must contain a black stone. Tally your hoard when the bag is empty. Most novel feature—the current player nominates who plays next! Don't worry, each player gets a turn in every round. Fascinating play for 1 to 5 players, Ages 8 and up.

http://www.gamepuzzles.com/abstrct2.htm#Gem

Name: Pushers & Pimps
Description:
This is a game that is inspired by Monopoly and is about the hard core streets of Copenhagen in Denmark, will you be one of the largest drug syndicates or will you send out your hoes and your pimps.

The game was only produced in 1500 copies, with the help from local shops and organizations.

Name: Top of the Goalposts
Description:
Top of the Goalposts is a DTP card game that simulates a soccer game between two generic teams. You play with a 50 cards deck that you have to end for two times (one for each half of the game). Each card is rated for Attack, Defense, Shot and Goal-Save and most of the cards have also a special action on them. Player with the ball must try to move ball from Midfield to Shot area, while the other must try to get the ball back and possibly start a rapid counterattack. There are rules for substitution and several special events.
Easy (Ages 7/8 and up), but fun and very fast and competitive.

Available for print & play through wargamedownloads.com in English version
Italian version, called "Incrocio dei pali" available for print & play through
arima.it

Name: Free for All
Description:
This is a very simple DTP card game, suitable from 2 to 5 players, Ages 10 and up, regarding a group of prison inmates transferred from one penal colony to another. During the transit, the convoy may be assaulted by other criminals trying to free their comrades, but it may even be defended by more police forces.
Each player may take the role of one of these two colliding factions, changing it from one turn to the other, trying to get as many convoys as he can for winning the game.
With a simple simultaneous action system, players try to get the more convoy cards they can, choosing wisely when to play the special cards that consent to win the hand without fight.

Components
1 deck of 16 convoy cards
1 deck of 47 action cards
One coin (not provided) for each player

Available as print & play through wargamedownloads.com

Name: Saving Primate Brian
Description:
This is a simple card game for 2 to 4 players, Ages 7 and up, about Brian, an almost extinct Orango, that needs food to survive. 
The aim of the game is to save 3 "Brians" (orangutan) from extinction, giving him the food he needs to survive. This is done by a simple draw/discard cards system, with several nuisances you may give to your opponents.
Made especially for children, the game is anyway good for all the family, with a small but important ecological message on it, as it is important to save the "real" Brians in our world

Components
1 deck of 63 cards

Available as print & play through wargamedownloads.com
Italian version, called "Salviamo il primate Brian" Available as print & play through arima.it

Name: Coggle
Description:
This Boggle version has all the principles of the original, but comes with 6 new kinds of dice: thematic ones.
Each thematic dice has a word that restricts the valid words you can find. For example: rivers, insects, cities, names, professions, colors, etc.

Name: Party & Co: Ingenios
Description: This is a Party game from the same creators of  Party & Co. The players have to come up with crazy definitions for very original words.

Name: Party & Co Expansion
Description:
This is an expansion for Party & Co. Comes with 200 new cards (1000 new challenges).

Expands:

    Party & Co

Name: The Funtastic Fitness game
Description: Players compete to become physically fit by using dice rolls and card drawing to navigate paths on the game board incorporating concepts of dieting, physical exercise, and "self awareness."

Name: Boney Head
Description:
This is an action/dexterity game that has players compete to remove glow in the dark bones from a plastic skull without disturbing it.

From the publisher: "Boney Head keeps all his spare bones in his head, your job is to remove them.  The bigger the bone the bigger the points. If you disturb Boney. he'll shriek and laugh so hard it just might wake the dead!"

Name: Hungry Huey
Description:
Hungry  Huey is a purple monster with an open mouth into which players reach to extract a particular set of "grubs."  If the players disturb Huey while they are reaching into his mouth, Huey responds by vomiting.

From the publisher: "Reach into Huey's 'real feel' gooey guts and risk vomtastic gastric action as you try and rescue your ghastly grubs from Huey's bloated tum.  You need to get the right four grubs to win, but watch out - if he vomits - you'll have to put one back!"

Name: University Challenge
Description: This is a family trivia game based on a popular TV quiz show in England.  There are four categories of trivia questions with difficulties ranging from basic to advanced, which makes the game more suitable for a family.  The game includes a buzzer and a flip card scorecard for each player, and a timer for the game.  Whoever is in the lead when the timer goes off is the winner.

Name: Niloe
Description: This is a card game published by the Cincinnati Game Company for many years as Niloe "Individual and Progressive Niloe," and/or "The Game of 'Niloe'".  The cards consists of topic cards and letter cards, and players compete to identify words fitting the topic that begin with the specified letter.

Name: Purple Ronnie's Twister
Description: This is a themed version of Twister using the stick-figure character Purple Ronnieand his frat-boy type humor.  The usual twister circles have been replaced with illustrations of such things as beer, vomit, and flatulence.

Name: Seesaw
Description:
Seesaw is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The game is played on a piece of wood with a flat upper surface but curved base - the seesaw. The flat surface has the two end areas marked off and each player has to take turns placing different kinds of wooden pieces in their respective areas, depending on the colour rolled on the special die. The pieces come in three colours, yellow cubes, blue cuboids (about twice the length of the yellow cube) and red cuboids (about four times the length of the yellow cubes).
The wooden die has round spots in these three colours (repeated once on the six sides). 
The idea is to be able to place your designated piece without toppling whatever has already been placed on the seesaw.
The twist is that the pieces all have two surfaces that are slightly convex.

Name: Banana Tower
Description:
Banana Tower is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The game consists of pieces of wood painted bright yellow and having a biconvex, lens-shaped cross section. There are eight larger pieces and five smaller pieces. Players try to build as tall a tower as they can, balancing the pieces one atop another on their convex surfaces.

Name: Apple Tree
Description:
Apple Tree is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

Players take turns placing leaves and apples on a tree, trying not to upset the whole structure. The main pieces is a naturally coloured piece of wood with a trunk and branches. The leaves are green wedges of wood and the apples are red cuboids.
In the process of playing the game, a pretty apple tree is created.

Name: Moon Dish
Description:
Moon Dish is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The eponymous Moon Dish is a hemispherical block of wood on which players take turns to place thin wooden dowels (with circular cross-sections) without upsetting the whole structure. The game comes with thirty dowels.

Name: LDS Sequence
Description:
A variant of Sequence, made for an LDS (Latter Day Saint) audience.  The game uses a single 60 card, 4 suit deck.

The four suits are: Peace, War, Famine, and Plenty.  Each card features one of the 15 books of the Book of Mormon, the '1' cards featuring the first book (1 Nephi) and the '15' cards featuring the last book (Moroni).

Name: Ord Mani
Description:
Sanamania (Word Mania) is a game where players draft cards that have four kinds of tasks related to words (association, forming compound nouns, listing words that have certain syllable in them, listing certain things such as tall buildings). When a card is picked each player writes on his/her notesheet as many words as possible (that fit the rules of the task, of course). An hourglass measures how much time they have. When time is up, players reveal their answers and get a point for every answer that is not on any other players sheet. The winner is simply the one with most points in the game end (when the cards on the board run out).

The Nelospelit version is not to be confused with the new Tactic version of A to Z; both are word games from the same publisher, but the mechanics are quite different.

Name: Madame Planchette's Horoscope Game
Description: The horoscope game is a basic set collection game with cards being drafted and discarded resulting in each player having a reading of their horoscope with finished hands.

Name: Nuclear Attack
Description:
Nuclear Attack is a game that presents in an abstract form the  nuclear warfare between equal superpowers. The idea is to make an succesful attack that destroys the central command of the opponent. Once the central command is destroyed the nation is annihilated.

The pieces of the game represent the nuclear explosions i.e. the 'mushrooms'. The board consists of cities and flight routes between the cities.

Name: The Abductinators
Description:
From the rulebook:

The players play the parts of alien Abductinators, sneaking through Grandma’s house late at night, trying to abduct the people there. The game uses pawns on a board to represent the aliens and humans in the house. The players choose their aliens’ actions by selecting action cards from their hands.

The humans act randomly: they get their actions dealt to them, no choice involved.

Gameplay is fast-paced and a bit silly. Sound effects, sloganeering and talking smack are all in the spirit.

Name: Pit Fighter: Fantasy Arena – Scenario Pack No. 1
Description:
In Pit Fighter: Fantasy Arena - Scenario Pack No. 1, a scenario pack for Pit Fighter: Fantasy Arena, you'll find four scenarios usable with the core rules and components found in the basic game and available expansions. Everything you need to play each scenario is included. Each scenario uses all of the core game rules unless exceptions and additions are noted in the rules that follow.

The scenarios included in Pit Fighter: Fantasy Arena - Scenario Pack No. 1 are:


     Watch Your Back, Steven Ellis
     Treasure in the Middle, Grey Endres
     The Stable, Nelson Beach
     Where Did He Go?, Nelson Beach

Name: Bohnröschen
Description:
Bohnröschen is an expansion playable only with Bohnanza or Ladybohn: Manche mÃ¶gen's heiss!.
Bohnanza in the land of fairy tales. As a bean prince you have to find the Sleeping Beauty (Beaning Beauty/Sleeping Beany?). You'll have to force the beanstalk thickets and complete difficult quests. The first to reach the castle carrying the most Beanthalers may kiss the Sleeping Beauty awake.

Contents
28 Beanstalk cards
6 Bean figures
4 3rd Beanfield cards
1 Castle card
1 Rule booklet

Part of the Bohnanza family of games.

Expands:

    Bohnanza
    Ladybohn: Manche mÃ¶gen's heiss!

Name: Cutthroat Caverns: Deeper & Darker
Description: The first expansion to Cutthroat Caverns, Deeper & Darker adds fifteen new monsters to hinder your quest to escape alive with the Sacred Item of Unimaginable Marvel...which means fifteen new monsters to use against your "friends" that are trying to escape with your artifact. It also adds some impact to character choice--each now has a unique ability, usable once per game, that might give you that special push that you need to make sure that you're the one left standing with the most Prestige when the dust settles.

Name: Bizerte Gertie
Description:
from CELEBRATING BOARD GAMES by Nina Chertoff and Susan Kahn.

This is a game that could only come from a different era.

Bertie Gertie is a game for 4 players, all servicemen on leave during World War II. Their goal is to take a walk with a beautiful woman on the beach. The object of the game is not to be the player left with the "ugly" one. The token game piece for that "ugly" girl was a "dog".

Name: Tank Battles in Miniature 3: A wargamers' guide to the North-West European Campaign 1944-1945
Description:
subtitle - A wargamer's guide to the North-West European Campaign 1944-1945

Book including miniatures rules for wargames in France/Lowcountries/Germany during WW2.

From the publisher's description;

"...includes eye-witness descriptions of armoured warfare in 1944-45; a brief chronology of the whole campaign, well illustrated by numerous maps; technical data in the tanks, armoured car, self-propelled guns and other weapons and vehicles used by both sides; and detailed descriptions of Allied and German army organisation at the time.
   There are sections too on amphibious assault, naval gunfire support on the invasion beaches, parachute and glider landings, tank and anti-tank gun data and ground attack and anti-aircraft fire"
Families: Series: Tank Battles in Miniature (Patrick Stephens Limited)

Name: Search & Rescue
Description:
Four areas in the Park are reserved for exploration: a lake with an island, desert conditions, mountainous trails and forest paths.

Stormy weather comes up and a child, a young woman, an older man and a family of five are missing. We are a search & rescue team sent out to find and rescue these missing persons.

We share equipment, develop strategies and contend with mounting storm centers! Tense, real life situations are faced. On each turn, tough choices have to be made. Only working as a team can lead to a happy ending.
 
Contents: 
12x12-inch board showing four park areas 
cards depicting motor power 
horn hailer 
infrared binoculars 
trained search dog 
GPS tracker 
storm passes 
rescue equipment: jeep, helicopter, boat & searchers 
4 people tokens 
28 storm tokens 
rules

Name: Scrabble Junior Madeline
Description: The Scrabble Junior Madeline edition features the adventurous little girl Madeline. She and her friends (Miss Clavel, Pepito and the eleven other girls) are out for a walk in the park. The board features pictures and the corresponding words for the people and things they encounter. Players earn one of Madeline's little yellow hats when they match their letters to the already spelled out words on the board. The board is two-sided, one side for French and the other English. Included with the game are 18 bilingual flash cards to teach French and English.

Name: All Stars Coach
Description: In All Stars Coach, players form their own soccer teams (based on real players; cards represent the players of a team). Different players have different prices, abilities and so on. After the card drafting phase the actual game begins where the actual soccer match is played on the game board.

Name: Mr. Frog
Description: Mr. Frog is a children's game where player put leaves on a fungus with a frog on it. As more leaves are put on the fungus it  becomes shaky and finally falls over, dropping the frog. The winner is the player who first loses all his/her leaves without dropping the frog.

Name: The Great War
Description:
The Great War is a World War I themed game along the lines of Axis and Allies. It introduces many new units, such as blimps, railway guns, cruiser and armored cars. As well as, aspects particular to the Great War, such as poison gas, trench warfare, convoys and railways. Additionally, neutral powers are subject to political influencing in order to draw them into one or other alliance.
The game is primarily available as a MapView module, but can also be played as a table top game.

Name: Multiplex
Description: German card game designed to assist children in learning multiplication tables along with shape and color recognition. Ages 7 and up

Name: Infernal Contraption 2: Sabotage!
Description:
Infernal Contraption 2: Sabotage! is an expansion the the Infernal Contraption base game.  It adds 48 new cards which include 3 new upgrades, 12 new power sources, 15 new consumables, and most importantly 18 sabotage cards!

What are sabotage cards? From the publisher:
A Sabotage card brings a new twist to the game. They allow you to throw the proverbial monkey wrench into your opponent's machine - making it malfunction is disastrous ways and all to your advantage. Put a stop to your opponent's pesky card-stealing contraptions, or power down his upgrades with sabotage cards like the Exothermic Reactor, Power Spike, or the Gremlin Sphere. You can really unleash some mayhem with these cards - and really ratchet up your own fun!

Expands:

    Infernal Contraption

Name: Police Patrol
Description: Police Patrol by Hasbro is a simple spin and move game where the object of the game is to watch out for unlawful or dangerous incidents that occur on your watch. You score points by dealing with things like Lost Children, Accidents, Traffic Violations and Robberies. Game comes with a plastic police car, 5 policemen, a cardboard town complete with police station and 3 spinners which determine what happens during the game.

Name: MasterMinds and Monkey-Shines
Description:
"Designed for Adults, Enjoyed by Children"

Three ways to play:

Game I - The Master Bluff (Ultimate Party or Parlor Game)

First player to reach 50 points wins.  Bluffmaster selects 3 cards, chooses one.  Reads the question aloud and answer aloud (from provided answers or makes one up).  One answer on the card is correct.  Opponents score points by correctly agreeing or disagreeing.

Game II - Black Jack (Twenty-one Points Makes You a Winner)
Roll a die to determine number of points scored or lost in a turn.  Answer trivia questions.  First to 21 wins.

Game III - Strike-Out (Groups and Groups of Fun)
For two large groups of players.  Each team lines up and face off (Family Feud style).  Players are eliminated with 3 incorrect answers.  Last one standing wins.

Equipment is a generous collection of question cards with multiple choice answers, an answer key, several agree and several disagree cards, die.

Name: Aliens
Description:
Aliens are here!

Everybody has seen them but not you. You have to find who are the liars and who tell the true.

Card game where the players play the role of the "lie detector".
They will try to guess if affirmations made by the other players are wrong when playing as “lie detector” or they will try to mislead the lie detector when making affirmations.

Name: Шпионы
Description:
In the decade of the 30s during the 20th century, with the hope of peace already lost, European powers try get organized before the war begins by improving their trust in their secret service organizations.

In this game, German Abwher, British SIS, Soviet NKVD and the French Surete compete to establish agent networks, adding new members in order to steal military secrets.

This game contains:
- A map of Europe from the 1930's
- 24 "spies" counters with numbers 1 to 6
- 32 "Top secret" counters
- 60 game cards
- 4 dice

Name: Eight Hours of Le Mans
Description:
Subtitled: A Convention Tournament Game. This reworking of the Avalon Hill classic Le Mans, is staged only at conventions, including Gen Con, and special weekend events.  The track is over 12' long and 6' wide.  Players wear numbered vests that match their cars and the cars are moved around the track as players choose their gear, speed, whether or not to risk corners, and manage their tires.  To a certain extent, players are also able to manage their cars' condition as they choose whether to drive conservatively, competitively, or press.  Pressing will increase a car's speed, while also increasing the chance of mechanical problems cropping up in the car.

Games last 5 - 24 hours, that's no joke, players schedule 24 hour games.  In "short" five-hour games, players race independently.  In 8-hour games, players drive in 2-man teams, and while "driving" players are not afforded food, drink, or bathroom breaks!  In the 24-hour version of the game, cars are driven by 2 or 3-man teams with players driving longer shifts, which allows time for sleeping.

Name: V-game
Description:
This is an anti-Nazi game from the 1940's which was produced by underground opposition forces in Belgium during the Second World War.

Players use a crude spring to launch wooden pieces onto a board with four sections of different point values. The two outer rings included the names of German cities. The third ring had cartoon images of top Nazi officials such as propaganda minister Joseph Goebbel. The inner ring - with the highest score of 100 points - showed Adolf Hitler.

The box for the game shows a picture of Hitler riding atop a German V-1 rocket and wearing a British royal crown.
(excerpts from CBC news coverage)

Name: Navigator
Description: A game of sail racing, players race around buoys while avoiding obstacles.  This is a very early game of hand management, as players pull and play cards from their hand of four trying to set up successful runs around the board.  Also of historical note, the game includes rules for a solitaire game and two alternative sets of rules using the same components.

Name: Duel of Eagles
Description:
Duel of Eagles is a set of miniatures rules designed for 1/300th scale miniature aircraft. It covers 1939-1945, and has plane statistics for a variety of aircraft in the WW2 time frame.

The movement system is hexless, and allows the player to tighten turns by utilizing changes in altitude.

Basic campaign rules are included.

Name: Shark Attack! Bowling
Description: This is a simple bowling game in which players take turns winding up a motorized shark and aiming it at six fish-shaped pins placed 2.5 to 3 meters away (8-10 ft) on a hard floor.  The motor is built such that the shark starts by moving slowly, but then quickly lunges forward.  A steering dial on the shark allows for hooks.

Name: Jeu des Petites annonces de France-Soir
Description:
Literally "Play of the small advertisements of France-evening"

				
				
					Description from A Gamut of GamesSid Sackson mentions this game on p12 of A Gamut of Games.  He writes that it "… has a delightful gallic flavor.  Players move around a board showing a map of Paris.  They acquire children by landing on the proper spaces.  The children are educated by landing on other spaces, after which they are sent out to work.  The winner is the first player who is able, by using the earnings of his children, to buy a bank."

Name: What's That?
Description: A "parlour game" in which points are scored by being able to identify everyday objects from photographs of them taken from unusual angles or close-up. Each guest gets a photograph and, during the course of the evening, when socialising, they can ask to see the other's photograph. They then write down what they think the answer should be. When their record sheet is full, they give it to the host. The one with the most correct answers wins.

Name: Война
Description:
In Ð’Ð¾Ð¹Ð½Ð° (War) each player take control of a German, division, allies division (deck). The card represent resources, battle groups, planes, artillery, heroes, tactical decisions, battle events…

There are different series "The Kharkov to El Alamein", "Stalingrad",  "Victory Day"…

Name: Claymores
Description: Rules for combat using bladed weapons. All known blades are listed or will match one listed. This is single figure combat. Most players can handle 4 figures at one time. Great for tournaments.

Name: Skirmishers
Description:
From Publisher's site

Rules for single figure combat 1780 to 1880. Especially the ACW and Indian Wars. Various weapons are available to choose from. There are rules for a block army version. Fantasy figures for this period are available, especially or the Nappy wars. Army lists are included.

Name: Brown Water Subs
Description:
From publishers site.

Take command of one of the five actual subs during the ACW. Each has its own special way of sinking the target. This solo game is quick, fun and habit forming. The example is the record board for your sub. Warning do not order if you hate losing. The chance to win is the same as it was in real life: 25%.
Great game to introduce older kids to gaming.

Name: The Glorious Cause
Description: The Glorious Cause is an introductory game on the American Revolution on a strategic level. It has an area movement map, a one-page set of rules and low number of counters.

Name: Urbs & Civitas
Description: Urbs & Civitas introduces the fundamental concepts of street addressing in the urban context all the while demonstrating the importance of its derived benefits: revenue generation, crime reduction, increased commerce & tourism, improved public health & safety, and good governance.  Integrating street addressing as the foundational tool in the urban management process, Urbs & Civitas then progresses by assigning much importance to continued infrastructure development.  Game play emphasizes strong player interaction and management skills by balancing revenue generation versus maintenance costs and promotes the advantages of street addressing through ongoing civic improvement.

Name: Chrono Blocks
Description:
From the Mindware site:

Tick, Tock—Quick, Find a Place for That Block!

Put your spatial skills to the test! Fit the correct block on the structure and hit the stop button before time runs out—move too slowly, and the base vibrates, setting off an avalanche of brightly colored pieces. Words, music and lights add urgency and get kids excited to play game after game. Includes 24 blocks, electronic building base with three levels of difficulty, volume control and auto shut-off feature. Requires three AA batteries (not included).

Ages 6 and up

Name: Ivor the Engine: Branch Lines
Description: Children's boardgame featuring the star of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. The first person to reach the engine shed wins. Some squares have access to Branch Lines that make you jump ahead or fall behind.

Name: Ivor the Engine: The Flower Game
Description:
Children's boardgame featuring the stars of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. Pick up three flowers for the flower show and return home to win.

Players may travel around the board in any direction they choose except backward. Land on a flower square to pick up a flower, land on a rectangle to pick up a card, or land on a circle to pick up a penny. Pennies can either modify a roll of the dice or 3 may be used to buy a flower.

Scans of the colourful components featuring elements of Ivor's adventures are available at: 
[url]http://www.smallfilms.co.uk/ivor/games.htm[/url]

Name: Wargods of Olympus
Description: Similar to WarGods of Ægyptus, Wargods of Olympus is a fantasy miniatures battles game with a quasi-historical theme. This time the theme is ancient Greece with players building and painting their own miniature armies of Spartans, Titans, Wendigos or other denizens of Greek Mythology.

Name: Slimetrail
Description:
Slimetrail is a two-player, abstract game played on a rectangular grid (or a rhombus made of hexagons, as in Hex). Each player takes turns moving a piece around the board. The piece can be moved one space, and may not re-visit a visited cell. Two goal cells are located at diagonally opposite corners of the rectangle (or in the obtuse corners of the rhombus). You win if either player moves the piece into your goal cell.

The rules at Game Cabinet state that "the piece starts on any mutually agreed upon square". But since this is a finite game, with enough computing power it can be determined which player has the winning strategy depending on the initial placement, so in principle no cell would be mutually agreeable. In practice, the Pie Rule can be used.

Name: Herbs
Description:
Space aliens captured and cloned a janitor named Herb to play a new game...

Herbs is a fun and simple strategy game where players make their moves simultaneously. It's like a simulated arcade game, which makes players rely more on good thinking than quick reflexes. Success in the game will depend on carefully devising your plans while leaving plenty of room for the unexpected.

Object
Each player will control two Herbs attempting to simply score the most points using 200 Action Points. Points will be scored by eliminating stones or by forming certain scoring patterns with the stones. Destroying an opponent's Herb also scores points.

Name: The Two Pipers
Description:
extracted from the Game Cabinet listing for the rules for this game:

This is a strategy game with simple rules. The complexity of play could be compared to that of checkers.

The game requires a standard checker board and eighteen markers for the game. A set of markers for one player consists of a PIPER and eight creatures. You'll need two sets, one for each player, in different colors. The creatures' markers are two-sided. One side of the marker shows the creature asleep, and the other shows it attacking. Not surprisingly, these creatures are referred to as "SLEEPERS" and "ATTACKERS" depending on which side is up.

The Object
Be the first to move your PIPER across the swamp or to eliminate your opponent's PIPER.

Winning the Game
If a player manages to get his or her PIPER across the swamp to the land where the opponent started, that player wins the game.

A player also wins if he or she eliminates the PIPER belonging to the opponent.

For purposes of winning, it is assumed that both PIPERS could stand on one of the land squares at the same time. In other words, a player can't prevent a win by planting his PIPER on the land and refusing to move it!

Name: Coronation St. DVD Game
Description:
Test your knowledge of Coronation Street as you journey to Roy's Rolls, Underworld, the Corner Shop and, of course, the Rovers Return, while watching clips and answering questions about one of television's most beloved soaps.

How much do you remember about Stan and Hilda or Jack and Vera? What about the love triangle between Ken, Deirdre and Mike or the one between Mike, Linda and Mike's son, Mark? How much do you really know about Roy and his transsexual wife Hayley, Tracy's mystery baby or the Weatherfield One? Find out as you compete for chips and trophies in this game that will prove just how "street smart" you really are.

This interactive DVD board game contains more than 700 questions across 6 different categories using clips, stills and story lines from this popular British soap opera.  Question categories include : Families, Workplace, Romance, Rovers, Feuds and Friendship.  Includes 12 Pub Quiz 'Beermats', featuring questions about the characters in the soap.

Name: Procession
Description:
Procession is an abstract strategy game of trying to move a master piece (queen) across a chess board along routes projected horizontally and vertically from 5 setup pieces (pawns).

Full rules are at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=55

Name: Loom
Description:
An abstract game where the players place markers on a chess board in sequence, where they can only place makers that are horizontally or vertically in line with their existing marker(s) without interrupt by other markers, and not placed such that they are on any line between a pair of existing markers of the same color.  Players are trying to form a box of their colour, or if they can't, have the longest lines of their color.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=57

Name: Royal-er Game of Ur
Description:
This is an abstract strategy game played with dice and a chess board.  You are trying to move your dice across the chess board (in a fixed zig-zag pattern) before your opponent has move their dice across the board in the opposite pattern.  The twist comes that after you have rolled and moved a die (which can be your own OR an opponents), it is placed on the board with the rolled number up, and if you land on a die, you move again based on the number showing, but forwards if it is your opponents die, but backwards if your own.

It has feeling of inspiration from a lot of traditional/classic board/chase games, including (obviously) Ur, but also Backgammon and Parcheesi.

Name: Statements
Description:
The Enron Game.

This game is a simulation of Enron and other corporate malfeasance type situations.  Players can either roll dice to (honestly) make profits or state a profit level - but at the cost of "audit points" which increase the risk that an audit may reveal the malfeasance.

Full rules and description at: https://web.archive.org/web/20070505132014/http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=36

Name: International Grand Prix Magnetic Road Race Game
Description:
"Completely self-contained... just remove cover and PLAY.  Magnetic cars stick to special game board."  - From front of box

Spin and move racing game with magnetic cars that stick to the track.

Name: Flying Swordsmen
Description:
An abstract game played on two chessboards and with stackable reversible counters.  The boards are seen as flip-sides of each other (like sides of a coin), one player starts setup in the center of one side, the other in the center of the other side, with the goal being to have only your markers on the other player's side.  Pieces can move farther and jump more adjacent pieces if they are stacked (up to 3 high).  If pieces are jumped over they are either converted to the other color or eliminated, depending on how many pieces have been jumped over.

Full rules at: https://web.archive.org/web/20070504174755/http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=24

Name: Brown Water Navies
Description:
The first chapter is the game. It covers all aspects of naval warfare during the American Civil War. Ramming, mines,
subs are also covered. The game is historical with one slight twist. It was written for what the ships were designed to do, not what they actually did. In this light two very powerful and equal fleets set sail. The players are the difference that decides the outcome.

The other chapters provide historical data to enrich the game. The original game has grown to be a one stop info source for the vessels of the ACW. For those without ship models.
110 different ships are provided on the cards on the CD. 90 vessels are drawn in black and white in Chapter 7. It also contains ACW photos of many of the ships. The game is design for all scales. Only four rules are different for the larger models, mainly distances.

Name: The Weider Game
Description:
"The Weider Game - it's more than a game!"
An educational fitness game based on dice, trivia, and physical challenges.  Game play is divided into two parts.

Events
The game begins with players trying to win medals in a series of events based mainly on dice rolls.  

    Weight Lifting - up to 3 dice rolls to gain the most points
    Walking - dice roll race with some values given special meanings
    Long Jump - simultaneous distance choice, identical numbers are canceled
    High Jump - dice rolls for numbers higher than an incremental value
    Sprint - dice roll race in turns



Weider Marathon
In the Weider Marathon players roll dice and move along the path.  On trivia squares, players answer educational questions about nutrition, anatomy, and sports.  Surprise squares often have the player trying to complete some physical task; some easy, some not.  Medals are used to fulfill a difficult question or challenge.  A player who retains a medal to the end does not have to finish with an exact dice roll.

Name: Tiamat
Description:
This is an abstract game that kind of resembles the old old video game "Snake" -- where you moved your snake around the screen eating blocks, and each block you ate lengthened your tail, making it harder to move.

But, your moving around a set of circular rings, collecting blocks that have different scoring values, in competition with everyone else collecting blocks that will grow your snake, and trying to end at the centre square with the most valuable snake you can get.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=18

Name: Node Ball
Description:
Node ball is an abstracted sports game, where you're trying to bounce one of three balls in the game through an opponents goal area.  You have several pieces that can move in varying ways to "kick" the ball, which then roll as far as the kicking piece moved in the opposite direction.  The game continues until all balls have scored, and the player with the most points wins.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=29

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: Selva
Description:
Played on a 13x13 Go board with go stones and 2 special stones each ("tigers"), the game is mostly about moving stones such that they bump opponents stones, with the hope to have them move past your tigers where they will get eaten.  The winner is first to eat the opponents tiger or eat all the opponents stones, or immobilize the opponents tiger.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=34

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: Kaiju Grand Prix
Description:
You're racing giant monsters after a little rabbit -- first to catch the rabbit wins.  Of course, you're a giant monster -- you can attack the other giant monsters, too.  Each monster has custom abilities, and a variable number of actions depending on its "heart rate", which starts at 1, and goes up as things happen.  You select as many dice as you have heart rate for different categories like attack, defense, or movement (simultaneously) then roll and evaluate.  So, the higher the heart rate, the better -- except if your heart rate exceeds 10, you explode and lose the race.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=26

Name: Conversion
Description:
This game is similar to the Flash game Proximity (available many places, for example: http://www.mathsisfun.com/games/proximity.html ).  Players roll a hand of 5 dice, then each in turn place them on a chess board.  If a die is placed adjacent to dice of the same player, those dice are promoted in value.  If placed adjacent to dice of another player, those dice are converted to the placing players color and raised one in value.  Several winning conditions are given, including most points, most area, and other options based on these.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=23

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: Tris
Description:
Tris combines some of the ideas of Tetris and Connect 4, with the further idea of pushing stones and them falling.  It is played on a chess board, and players alternate either placing stones or moving them.  Place stones can be placed on either edge, or a at the top of a column of stones from an edge.  Stones can be moved one space left or right into an unoccupied space, and if it is unsupported, they "fall" to the bottom.  Four stones in a row of your color are "captured" and removed from the board, the remaining stones "fall", and if more 4-in-a-rows result, this recurses.  Stones in a full row are locked.  Winner is first to capture 12 of their own pieces, or to fill their side of the board with locked rows.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=37

Name: Planecrash
Description:
Planecrash is a game played with Magic: The Gathering cards, though it has almost nothing to do with that game.  Players select a deck of cards of various colors (color determined based on M:TG rules), shuffle it, then play from the shuffled deck.  The place a card on one of three piles based on color relationships, with the chance to capture a pile or create a particular combination of colors on top of the three piles.  Creating the correct combination, or collecting the most cards, results in a win.

Full rules at: https://web.archive.org/web/20070504074239/http://www.luchacabra.com:80/?p=30

Name: Cech zlodějů
Description:
Cech zlodÄ›jÅ¯) ("Thieves Guild") is a fast-paced card game where you become a thief among thieves. The "winner" is the player who is most successful in robbing the others. You can't trust anyone here, the police are corrupt and the other well-known companies in town never sleep either. They are constantly watching you and will use every opportunity to get your money back, even with interest. For these cases, it is always useful to have a bribe or a well-guarded safe in your pocket.

In each round, a player starts by buying cards. He can buy one or more cards from the supply pack, for which he pays with his gold. The first card costs one gold, if the player wants more cards, it is always more expensive. Gold used to buy cards creates a bank next to the supply deck. It is empty at the beginning of the game. If the card says "remove" the gold, it means to put it in the bank. After buying the cards, the player goes to loot.

During the Loot phase, a player rolls the dice twice. The first roll determines how many gold he can loot that round. If no opponent reacts to this throw, the player throws a second time. The second roll determines who gets robbed that turn. The number of points rolled is the distance of the opponent to be robbed. The player whose turn it is decides whether to count to the left or to the right. If the roll equals the number of players, the roller, he cannot rob anyone.

The game ends when one player loses all their gold. The player with the most gold wins.
